titleStmt.title: A merry dialogue betwixt a married man and his wife, concerning the affaires of this carefull life To an excellent tune.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A20399 of text S117121 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 6809). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 6 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 2 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A merry dialogue betwixt a married man and his wife, concerning the affaires of this carefull life To an excellent tune.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcocke,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "I have for all good wives a song,".
Attribution to Parker and suggested place and date of publication from STC.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
